answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found policies you might find helpful.
Below is the Policy Concerning the Disposal of Dead Farm Animals from Tennessee. 
http://tn.gov/agriculture/publications/regulatory/animaldisposal.pdf
This animal removal policy is from Eldorado County, CA. http://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=16&ved=0CFQQFjAFOAo&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.edcgov.us%2FGovernment%2FBOS%2FPolicies%2FG-3.aspx&ei=Z7-uTpzkDorl0QHCyM24Dw&usg=AFQjCNH1Mdct5l6q9t_FJYgKphqeQugPvg&sig2=hm3AHqw1sJvbTORRj-3CPg
This report from Clemson University discusses best practices and procedures for animal removal services.
http://www.clemson.edu/extension/livestock/livestock/camm/camm_files/swine/sch8_03.pdf
I hope these help as a start.
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: D McClelland
text:
Does your jurisdiction provide this service?  If so, the City of Dallas, Texas would like to query you on your operations.  We're not only interested in the logistics and metrics of your program, but also in how you reward and recognize employees who perform this vital public health function.
If you're interested please respond to the attached survey.  A compilation of all responses will be shared with each responder.
Thank you.
title: Dead Animal Collections
